Effects of Battle on Fatigue and Stress.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): FAQ: The Most Important Game Data: Effects of Battle on Fatigue and Stress.
By Dark Phoenix on Sunday, July 15, 2001 - 01:55 am:

Now, it's finally time for a long overdue post, namely the effects of Battle on Stress and Fatigue.

First off, HP lowering does NOT seem to have any effect on Stress or Fatigue. In fact, the effects are not tallied until the end of the tournament. As for the effects, battles causes a large amount of fatigue to a monster (duh) but it also lowers stress BIG TIME. It doesn't automatically elminate all stress, but it does cause it to drop sharply, it's also a fixed amount, not a percentage, so stress CAN drop to zero.

Here are the effects I found:

Win tournament: +37 Fatigue, -75 (!) Stress
Do well in tournament, but don't win: +50 Fatigue, -62 Stress
Do poorly in tournament: +62 Fatigue, - 50 Stress

Also, withholding praise from your monster can cause Stress to increase. The amount depends on the reaction.

Monster is angry: +8 Stress
Monster is disappointed: +4 Stress

Curiously, withholding encouragement does not incur Stress.

Note that the exception to this is the IMa-FIMBA meets, which appear to cause more Fatigue than usual. I may get around to testing this at a later date.

Hope you find this useful. Later!
